title: Single-cell 101
text:
Preface
This course covers the basics of single-cell RNA-seq analysis. This material was meant to be continuously improved.
This book is based on three main references:

Orchestrating Single-Cell Analysis with Bioconductor - Basics;
Single-cell best practices
Best practices for single-cell analysis across modalities (Heumos, Schaar, and Lance 2023)





Heumos, Lisa, Anne C. Schaar, and Claire et al. Lance. 2023. “Best Practices for Single-Cell Analysis Across Modalities.” Nat Rev Genet 24: 550–72. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41576-023-00586-w.

title: 2  Importing data and performing quality control
text:
2.1 Import data from Cell Ranger
What information are the matrices produces by CellRanger?
The MEX format
Let’s import cellranger output:

# list files 
raw_files_dir <- "data/kidney/raw/"

# Import with Read10X:
counts <- Read10X(here::here(raw_files_dir))

title: 2  Importing data and performing quality control
2  Importing data and performing quality control
2  Importing data and performing quality control
2  Importing data and performing quality control
3  Clustering and markers identification
text:
3.1 Motivation
This document summarises the basics to normalize, find variable genes, perform principal component analysis, cluster cells by gene expression, and perform other dimensionality reductions such as UMAP and t-SNE.
One critical step in any single-cell analysis consists in identifying the set of highly variable genes. These genes will direct further steps and therefore, it is essential to pay attention to the results obtained.

title: 3  Clustering and markers identification
text:
7.1 Now, let’s pipe all operations

load("results/sc_qc.rda")
sc_qc_SRR13606306 <- subset(sc_qc, orig.ident == "SRR13606306")

sc_qc_SRR13606306 <- sc_qc_SRR13606306 %>% 
  NormalizeData(normalization.method = "LogNormalize", scale.factor = 10000) %>% 
  FindVariableFeatures() %>% 
  ScaleData() %>% # By default it takes the HVG
  RunPCA() %>% 
  FindNeighbors(reduction = "pca", dims = 1:20) %>% 
  FindClusters(resolution = 0.5) %>% 
  RunUMAP(dims = 1:20, n.components = 2, seed.use = 123) %>% 
  RunTSNE(dims = 1:20, n.components = 2, seed.use = 123)

Plot the data embedded on the three dimensionality reductions performed:

DimPlot(sc_qc_SRR13606306, reduction = "pca")
DimPlot(sc_qc_SRR13606306, reduction = "tsne")
DimPlot(sc_qc_SRR13606306, reduction = "umap")

Save

save(sc_qc_SRR13606306, file = "results/sc_qc_SRR13606306_findclusters.rda")
